result.execSummary:
The defendant Abdul J Pirtle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges by 02-21-2017 or as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

**If the defendant commits no new crimes and has no new arrest, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.
With credit for 13 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdul J Pirtle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: If the defendant commits no new crimes and has no new arrest, Court will grant expungement after 1 year

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 13 days in the House of Correction with credit for 13 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 02-21-2017 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  
If the defendant commits no new crimes and has no new arrest, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in court with attorney Zoe Everett for Robert J Hampton with student intern Dan Larsen.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in court with  Student Intern Dan Larson under the supervision of attorney Mark Dluzak.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case was set for Status Conference at 8:30. The defendant did not appear. Case passed until the afternoon. Defendant appeared. Court reiterated the importance of being on time to court.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in court with attorney Austin Mort on behalf of Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense requested additional time to review discovery with defendant. Court grants defense request.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in court with attorney Austin Mort.  Defendant Abdul J Pirtle in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Abdul J Pirtle
Current: 2321 N Booth St, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 05-31-2016)
Prior: 1223 North 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Abdul J Pirtle not in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-101

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/27/15 @ 1:30pm
